Material used.Description: Affinity-purified FLAG-tagged PINK1 from transfected HeLa cell extracts and PC12 cells were used for in vitro kinase assays.

Readout description.Result Description: The G309D mutation virtually abolished the kinase activity of PINK1 in phosphorylating TRAP1.
The L347P mutation virtually abolished the kinase activity of PINK1 in phosphorylating TRAP1.
The W437X mutation did not significantly affect kinase activity in vitro but showed reduced phosphorylation in vivo.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent mean ± SEM from three independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control for kinase activity.

Basic negative control.Description: Control without PINK1 (absence of kinase) was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Tukey's post hoc analysis was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Phosphorylation levels comparable to wild-type PINK1 activity (normalized levels not significantly different from wild-type).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation levels significantly reduced compared to wild-type PINK1 activity (p < 0.01).

Material used.Description: PC12 cells were used to assess in vivo phosphorylation of endogenous TRAP1.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells overexpressing G309D mutant PINK1 had approximately 50% lower levels of both basal and oxidative-stress-induced TRAP1 phosphorylation.
Cells overexpressing L347P mutant PINK1 had approximately 50% lower levels of both basal and oxidative-stress-induced TRAP1 phosphorylation.
The W437X mutation caused a 30% to 45% reduction in both basal and oxidative-stress-induced TRAP1 phosphorylation compared to wild-type PINK1.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent mean ± SEM from three independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 overexpression was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Tukey's post hoc analysis was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Phosphorylation levels increased by at least 3-fold compared to untransfected cells under basal conditions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation levels reduced by 50% or more compared to wild-type PINK1 under basal or stress conditions.

Material used.Description: PC12 cells were used to assess cell viability under oxidative stress conditions.

Readout description.Result Description: The G309D mutation abolished the cytoprotective effect of PINK1 and exacerbated oxidative-stress-induced cell death.
The L347P mutation abolished the cytoprotective effect of PINK1 and exacerbated oxidative-stress-induced cell death.
The W437X mutation significantly reduced the ability of PINK1 to protect against oxidative-stress-induced cell death.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent mean ± SEM from three independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1-transfected cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Tukey's post hoc analysis was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell survival significantly higher than vector-transfected controls under oxidative stress (p < 0.01).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cell survival not significantly different or lower than vector-transfected controls under oxidative stress (p < 0.01).

Material used.Description: PC12 cells were used to assess cytochrome c release from mitochondria under oxidative stress.

Readout description.Result Description: The G309D mutation abolished the ability of PINK1 to suppress cytochrome c release and accelerated release under oxidative stress.
The L347P mutation abolished the ability of PINK1 to suppress cytochrome c release and accelerated release under oxidative stress.
The W437X mutation caused a significant increase in cytochrome c release compared to wild-type PINK1 under oxidative stress.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent mean ± SEM from three independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1-transfected cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Tukey's post hoc analysis was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Significant reduction in cytochrome c release compared to vector-transfected controls under oxidative stress (p < 0.01).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: No reduction or increased cytochrome c release compared to vector-transfected controls under oxidative stress (p < 0.01).
